name: Americas Best Value Airport Inn

reviews.text: I paid so little for this room (about $50) that I was expecting it to be really bad. I was pleasantly surprized. The room was nice and clean and the staff was pleasant and helpful. I did not make use of their airport shuttle so I can't judge that, but I was surprized that a hotel so cheap even had a shuttle.
reviews.title: Clean Room - No Problems
Clean rooms
reviews.text: The rooms are basic, but look very nice. The beds are ok and everything was very clean. The staff was friendly. You can take a free shuttle to the airport, which is nearby. Another options is that you can park your car there, which is much cheaper then parking at the airport.

reviews.title: Top 10 Reasons I Won't Be Going Back
reviews.text: 1. Only a mile from airport, but waited long time to get picked up by shuttle (at midnite). Saw other airport shuttles come and go 2 or 3 times while waiting.
2. Greeted in room by strong, noxious odor (assumed to be bug killer judging from other reviews).
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

reviews.text: 3. Loud, marginally effective in-wall air conditioner featuring musty, stale smell.
reviews.title: Ants come with the room - free!!
Horrible! Stay away.
reviews.text: First and most importantly, I didn't feel safe. Also, the motel was old and felt unclean. They recently slapped paint on the rooms but that's about it. The bathroom was old and stained. The blanket was thin it was useless and there were cigarette burns (in a nonsmoking room) in it. The bed was a ROCK and it was impossible to get comfortable. There was no clock in the room. The front desk staff, when you could find them, were cold and a little rude. The shuttle van to the airport was too small for place which specializes in easy access to the airport. Just a horrible stay...if I hadn't paid in advance through a service, I would have left. Lots of other nice hotels on the same street.

reviews.title: Spend a few more dollars to stay somewhere else
reviews.text: The price seemed right, we needed a place near the airport for one night, and we figured, how bad could it be? As one reviewer noted, it is clean, and it was cheap, but that's about all that it had going for it. The bed was absolutely terrible--it had a visible tilt to one side, and you could feel the failing springs. The road noise was loud, even when the planes weren't flying. All in all, it made for a lousy night's sleep. And the towels were so thin and small as to be ridiculous. Spend a few extra bucks and stay somewhere else where you might actually be able to sleep.

reviews.title: Very clean!
reviews.text: Very basic motel, the services are pretty on par with the price. The rooms are very CLEAN, which i was very happy about (cheap motels can be a little sketchy sometimes.) The staff were helpful and friendly. I would definately stay here again!

reviews.title: False charge to my credit card
reviews.text: I booked a room at this inn but canceled the room prior to my arrival there. I phoned the inn twice about this matter to be sure I was not charged for the room, and I was told twice that I would NOT be charged.

reviews.title: dependable
reviews.text: However, the inn charged me for the room on my credit card. I am now disputing this charge.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at this motel several times and find that it is good value for a one night or short stay either coming or going from a Seatac airport trip. Their park 'n fly packages and/or airport parking are good value as well when compared to other airport parking nearby. The rooms are quite plain and I wouldn't chose to spend a lot of time in them, but I have always had a good enough sleep and found the rooms reasonably clean. Service is likely not quite as good as more expensive places nearby and I have found the airport shuttle service does not always run closely to each 1/2 hour (the last time I waited about 50 minutes at the airport; however, most times you get picked up within the 1/2 hour and I have never had a problem with getting shuttled on time to the airport). The breakfast consists pretty much of packaged muffins and coffee, so don't expect a full continental breakfast. In summary, I will stay there again as ABVI provides good value for airport access and parking as well as adequate service, but I don't go there for a 'fancy' hotel experience.
reviews.title: Good value for airport access and vehicle parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shuttle service from the airport was good, we just called them from the courtesy phones at the airport and they were there to collect us within 20 minutes. The shuttle took about 10 mins to get to the accommodation.
reviews.title: Good for the airport and good value for money

reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights, our room was a good size, very clean and good air conditioning and had everything we needed for a comfortable stay. Free wifi was good and reliable. It wasn't the quietest place to be honest, there is quite a bit of road noise as it's positioned just off a main road, although it is good value for the money.
reviews.title: Very disappointed in lack of customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast isn't really a breakfast, packs of 2 small muffins were available until 930am in reception, there is a coffee machine there too and sunny delight. There is an I-hop about 5 minutes walk up the road which was lovely and I would recommend.
reviews.title: Cheap & Clean

reviews.text: Getting to downtown Seattle does take a while. You need to get a bus ($2.25 one way and you must have correct change) to the airport, then catch the lite train to downtown, $5.50 for a day pass. All in all the journey takes about 1 hour each way.
reviews.title: As the name suggests: good value
What a great stay - so nice to have someone arrange everything
reviews.text: We stayed here one night before leaving to head back to Denver and has a fantastic experience. The rooms were very clean. The beds were comfortable and the guy that check us in arranged everything after we told him we had to be at the airport at 5 a.m. Told us we needed to get to the shuttle by 4:30 and he would schedule a wake up call for 4 for us. It was nice to have him think of it all as we had a very long week. Andre is the younger kid that works the night shift and he is great as well.

reviews.title: Excellent Overnight Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed one night at the ABVAI prior to taking an early morning flight. Check in was fast and efficient and the front desk clerk was most helpful and friendly. The room itself was very clean and although it wasn't overly soundproof we had no complaints. The shuttle to the airport was great, again very friendly staff. Used the shuttle on the return trip and were very impressed at how quickly they were there to pick us up. Overall this was a great hotel for a pre-flight stay and we would definately return.

reviews.title: Great place to stay for the price!
reviews.text: We have stayed at Americas Best Value 3 times, the first 2 times, a one night stay before and after a flight to Hawaii. We used a park and fly package, and it was very economical. A clean place to stay, and a comfortable bed. A bit noisy with road noise, as we were in the front portion, but a very good value. The third time, 6 days for an extended business trip. Again, a clean and comfortable room. for an extended stay, a small fridge & microwave would have been nice, and may have been at a slight extra charge. We were surprised though, as we had booked it on priceline at the name your own price, $240. for 6 days. When we got there, right on the sign in front it was advertised at $195 weekly rate. We just checked out today, and are going to haggle with priceline about their "best price guarantee"!

reviews.title: Great Value
reviews.text: We have been in three seperate rooms, at different times. The one complaint I would make, is that all three times I tried to take a bath, the bathtub plugs do not hold water. I did not ask someone to help out, I just took a shower instead!

reviews.title: Worse customer service from staff and manager
reviews.text: We stayed here in March 2012, for a park and fly package. I searched around for the best price for our Canadian dollar, and booked via a travel website. We had 2 rooms as we had 5 people, and one was attached to a park and fly package for our van. It was very busy when we arrived, so our van had to be valet parked. Last time we were there we did a self park in the gated lot. The front desk clerk was very welcoming and friendly. The reasons we chose this hotel were price, clean rooms, and a free shuttle service to the airport. The room are small, however for a one night sleepover and a place to park our van for the week that was in a gated lot, we feel we received good value. This hotel is not a resort, nor a completely soundproof one (the flight path is overhead after all) but a great choice for a stop before or after your flight. Our flight was early, so we did not get the breakfast, but got our requested wakeup at 3am and left for the airport at 3:30. The drivers for delivery and pickup were courteous and prompt.Nearby to this hotel within walking distance is an IHOP where we had dinner the night before we left. We were satisfied with the meal and service there. We will definitely stay again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights during mid July, 2012. Prior to our stay I spent considerable time reading reviews. Like almost any motel, no matter the price, you will find good and negative comments. I am pleased to say that we were very surprised and appreciative of our room (212). Instead of a Queen, as advertised, we had a King bed. It was quite comfortable. The carpet was newer, the counter tops were clean and spacious enough. For the money, we were particularly surprised to find a recliner chair in the room. It was not the cleanest but okay. The noise from the airport and the busy street wasn't even bad. The windows and general room construction was fairly sound proof. No big problem. IHOP is within easy walking distance at 2 blocks North.
reviews.title: A Very Good Value

reviews.text: Minor negatives: Bathroom fan was very loud, No coffee in room and rarely available in the Office.
reviews.title: Good basic place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our Girl Scout troop had saved their money for the past several years to go on a special trip. We were heading to a cruise to Alaska and wanted to also spend a day in Seattle since none of us had never been in the area. We need a relative cheap but decent place to stay. This hotel fit into our plans well. The staff was friendly and helpful. Out room was nice - nothing special, but met our needs. We had to rely on the local buses and link rail to get around. The bus stop is just a little way down the road. The motel has a free shuttle from and to the airport which was easy to use, especially since we arrived at midnight.
reviews.title: Nice clean ,quiet hotel.
Good basic motel and stay...
reviews.text: We spent one night at this motel. The room was clean and comfortable. The shuttle picked us up from the airport and all staff members were friendly .Our room was quiet and the wifi worked ok. We also had a fridge in the room. The hotel is in a good location with plenty of fast food and restaurants nearby. We have stayed in a few different hotels in Seatac and this was the best so far.
I was headed to NYC for 4 days and drove down from Vancouver, BC to Seattle for my flight. I needed a room for one night, and a place to keep my car for the days I was away.
reviews.title: Fantastic place to park!!!

reviews.text: Booked this hotel online after looking @ reviews of this property & others on Trip Advisor.
reviews.title: Traffice noise, paper thin walls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the front desk told us we were given an 'updated' room with new carpet. The carpet looked as if it was from the 70s & was so disgusting we didn't take our shoes off. We could hear the people in the room next to us talking. Our room was directly above the office & around 1am there was this horrible machine noise that ran for @ least 30 minutes.
reviews.title: Will stay again
Old and tired
reviews.text: Yes, it does offer stay, park & fly (we paid $83 including tax for 1 night & 7 nights parking) but the property is right on the road. You'll here the traffic.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 2nd visit to this hotel. It is near the airport, and they do have a shuttle to the airport only. The rooms are always clean and smell fresh. This trip some renovations had been done on the bathroom. Staff is always friendly on the phone and in person.
reviews.title: Fine for an overnight

reviews.text: Please note if you are planning on renting a car when you arrive in Seattle they have a new Car Rental Center where most of the car companies run out of. It is on the other side of the airport and no longer walking distance from this motel. We will continue to stay here on our visits to WA. Can't beat the price!
reviews.title: Ok for only one night

aka: Americas Best Value Airport Hotel Seatac
